title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 176.3 - Leashed tracking dog license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 176.3 - Leashed tracking dog license

State Regulations
A leashed tracking dog license issued by the department
entitles the licensee to: (a) use
certified leashed tracking dogs at any time, with or without the aid of an
artificial light, to track and recover dead, wounded or injured big game during
all big game seasons, including Saturdays and Sundays, and the 24-hour period
immediately following the last day of a big game season; (b) dispatch wounded or injured big game
animals which have been tracked and found in accordance with and pursuant to
the conditions of such license; (c) temporarily possess a big game animal which has been dispatched by the
licensee, or reduced to possession by the licensee, until lawfully tagged or
until delivered to an environmental conservation officer pursuant to the
conditions of such license; (d) use
certified leashed tracking dogs at any time, with or without an artificial
light, to track and recover big game which are: (1)
dead, wounded or injured as the result of
activities authorized by permit issued under the authority of the Environmental

Conservation Law, section 11-0521 or under the authority of Environmental

Conservation Law, section 11-0523; or
(2)
dead, wounded or injured as the result of
an accident. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
176.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
